meanings.definition: A device used in photography to project and enlarge a negative onto photographic paper.
meanings.sent1: The enlarger in the darkroom helped make the small negative bigger on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The photographer used the enlarger to create a larger print of the image.
meanings.sent3: When the enlarger in the darkroom broke, it started projecting funny shapes on the paper.
meanings.sent4: The enlarger was like a magical magnifying glass, turning tiny negatives into big photographs.
meanings.sent5: The bright light from the enlarger made the image on the paper come to life.

meanings.definition: To make or become larger in size or extent.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to enlarger the font size on her computer screen for better visibility.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to enlarger their production capacity to meet the increasing demand.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally used a wrong setting and ended up enlarging the picture way too much.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to enlarger the room, filling it with warmth and joy.
meanings.sent5: The rain helped to enlarger the puddles on the road, making it difficult to walk around.
